Sega
Type
 Privately held, subsidiary
Industry Computer and video games
Key people
 Yuji Naka, Rikiya Nakagawa, Noriyoshi Oba, Hisao Oguchi, Yu Suzuki, Toshihiro Nagoshi,
Products Video games
Parent Sega
Website sega
sega.jp

This is a list of development studios owned by Sega, a multinational videogame developer and publisher based out of Tokyo, Japan.

Contents

  • 1 1983–1990
    • 1.1 Arcade development division
    • 1.2 Consumer development division
  • 2 1990–1999
    • 2.1 Arcade development division

    • 2.3 Consumer development division
  • 3 1999–2004
    • 3.1 Studio list
  • 4 2005–2009

    • 4.2 New Entertainment division
    • 4.3 Arcade development division
  • 5 2009–present
    • 5.1 Consumer development division
    • 5.2 Arcade development division
    • 5.3 Mobile development division
  • 6 Acquired/founded studios
  • 7 Contracted studios
    • 7.1 Japanese
    • 7.2 Western
  • 8 References
